level.text: No particular form is prescribed for applications, motions, and other papers which may be filed in proceedings under these rules.
Each request for hearing, motion, or other paper, which may be filed in proceedings under these rules, shall meet the following requirements:
Contain a clear, concise statement of the facts and the relief sought; and
Be signed by each party involved or the party’s representative.
Each document, including the request for a hearing, shall be filed with the Office of Fair Hearings.
When a pleading or other document is filed, the filer shall serve a copy of the pleading or document on each party in the action.
Unless otherwise ordered by the hearing examiner, filing of documents may be accomplished by first class mail.
Filing shall be considered complete upon receipt.
